page.title: 01Countryside W of Chillaton
page.content: The block consists of hilly countrysie varying from 300 to 750 ft, with small steep sided valleys draining north east to the river Lyd. The majority of the block if farmland used for rearing livestock, mainly sheep and beef, but with dairy herds on a number of Parms. the block contains land belonging to some 15 farms. The main settlement is the village of Chillaton which provied a small focus of facilities, but has no church of its own. marystow church on an adjoining hill being in a different parish, still privately owned the fine elizabethan shydenham house stands by the river Lyd surounded by its farm and woodland. Employment is mainly provided by Agriculture and related activites, with a small stone quarry and 2 country builders also providing employment. Many people now work in
